text: ' near Hamamatsu, Shizuoka Prefecture dates from the 14th century. Mumon Gensen (son of Emperor Go-Daigo) founded the temple in 1371. Since 1903, Hōkō- ji has been the main temple of the Hōkō-ji sect of the Rinzai school of Buddhism. == See also == * For an explanation of terms concerning Japanese Buddhism, Japanese Buddhist art, and Japanese Buddhist temple architecture, see the Glossary of Japanese Buddhism. ==External links== *Official site Category:Hōkō-ji temples Category:Rinzai temples Category:Buddhist temples in Shizuoka Prefecture
title: Hōkō-ji (Shizuoka)
